cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi W of Key West, Florida and 270 mi W of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn N-NW tonight, then N-NE on Wednesday, crossing Florida’s Big Bend Thursday evening and then accelerating NE just offshore of the GA/SC/NC coasts and out into the western Atlantic

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued as of Advisory #7 (interests from central/northern Florida through SE Georgia advised to monitor)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend, southeastern Georgia, coastal South and North Carolina, then western Atlantic well east of Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late Friday–Saturday with gusts generally below tropical-storm force (most likely 20-30 mph, isolated 35 mph).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Baltimore; water-level rise in Chesapeake Bay should stay below 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–2 inches of rain to central Maryland late Fri–Sat, well below 4-inch threshold.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Choppy seas on Chesapeake Bay and reduced visibility from periods of heavy rain may impact vessel scheduling and cargo handling.
